verses.verse: from the base on the ground to the lower ledge, two cubits; the width of the ledge, one cubit; from the smaller ledge to the larger ledge, four cubits; and the width of the ledge, one cubit.
The altar hearth is four cubits high, with four (Ex. 27:2; Lev. 9:9; 1 Kin. 1:50) horns extending upward from the hearth.
The altar hearth is twelve cubits long, twelve wide, (Ex. 27:1) square at its four corners;
the ledge, fourteen cubits long and fourteen wide on its four sides, with a rim of half a cubit around it; its base, one cubit all around; and (Ex. 20:26) its steps face toward the east.”

(Consecrating the Altar) And He said to me, “Son of man, thus says the Lord GOD: ‘These are the ordinances for the altar on the day when it is made, for sacrificing (Ex. 40:29) burnt offerings on it, and for (Lev. 1:5, 11; (Heb. 9:21, 22)) sprinkling blood on it.

You shall give (Ex. 29:10; Lev. 8:14; Ezek. 45:18, 19) a young bull for a sin offering to (Ezek. 44:15, 16) the priests, the Levites, who are of the seed of (1 Kin. 2:35; Ezek. 40:46) Zadok, who approach Me to minister to Me,’ says the Lord GOD.
‘You shall take some of its blood and put it on the four horns of the altar, on the four corners of the ledge, and on the rim around it; thus you shall cleanse it and make atonement for it.
Then you shall also take the bull of the sin offering, and (Ex. 29:14; Lev. 4:12) burn it in the appointed place of the temple, (Heb. 13:11) outside the sanctuary.
On the second day you shall offer a kid of the goats without blemish for a sin offering; and they shall cleanse the altar, as they cleansed it with the bull.
When you have finished cleansing it, you shall offer a young bull without blemish, and a ram from the flock without blemish.
When you offer them before the LORD, (Lev. 2:13; Num. 18:19; (Mark 9:49, 50; Col. 4:6)) the priests shall throw salt on them, and they will offer them up as a burnt offering to the LORD.
Every day for (Ex. 29:35; Lev. 8:33) seven days you shall prepare a goat for a sin offering; they shall also prepare a young bull and a ram from the flock, both without blemish.
Seven days they shall make atonement for the altar and purify it, and so consecrate it.

(Lev. 9:1-4) When these days are over it shall be, on the eighth day and thereafter, that the priests shall offer your burnt offerings and your peace offerings on the altar; and I will (Ezek. 20:40, 41; (Rom. 12:1; 1 Pet. 2:5)) accept you,’ says the Lord GOD.”
(The East Gate and the Prince) Then He brought me back to the outer gate of the sanctuary (Ezek. 43:1) which faces toward the east, but it was shut.
And the LORD said to me, “This gate shall be shut; it shall not be opened, and no man shall enter by it, (Ezek. 43:2-4) because the LORD God of Israel has entered by it; therefore it shall be shut.

As for the (Gen. 31:54; Ex. 24:9-11; (1 Cor. 10:18)) prince, because he is the prince, he may sit in it to (Ezek. 46:2, 8) eat bread before the LORD; he shall enter by way of the vestibule of the gateway, and go out the same way.”

(Those Admitted to the Temple) Also He brought me by way of the north gate to the front of the temple; so I looked, and (Is. 6:3; Ezek. 3:23; 43:5) behold, the glory of the LORD filled the house of the LORD; (Ezek. 1:28; 43:3) and I fell on my face.

And the LORD said to me, (Deut. 32:46; Ezek. 40:4) “Son of man, mark well, see with your eyes and hear with your ears, all that I say to you concerning all the (Deut. 12:32; Ezek. 43:10, 11) ordinances of the house of the LORD and all its laws. Mark well who may enter the house and all who go out from the sanctuary.
“Now say to the (Ezek. 2:5) rebellious, to the house of Israel, ‘Thus says the Lord GOD: “O house of Israel, (Ezek. 45:9; 1 Pet. 4:3) let Us have no more of all your abominations.

(Ezek. 43:8; Acts 21:28) When you brought in (Lev. 22:25) foreigners, (Lev. 26:41; Deut. 10:16; Jer. 4:4; 9:26; (Acts 7:51)) uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, to be in My sanctuary to defile it—My house—and when you offered (Lev. 21:17) My food, (Lev. 3:16) the fat and the blood, then they broke My covenant because of all your abominations.
And you have not (Lev. 22:2; Num. 18:7) kept charge of My holy things, but you have set others to keep charge of My sanctuary for you.”

Thus says the Lord GOD: (Ezek. 44:7; Joel 3:17; Zech. 14:21) “No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart or uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter My sanctuary, including any foreigner who is among the children of Israel.
(Laws Governing Priests) (2 Kin. 23:8; Ezek. 48:11) “And the Levites who went far from Me, when Israel went astray, who strayed away from Me after their idols, they shall bear their iniquity.

Yet they shall be ministers in My sanctuary, (1 Chr. 26:1-19) as gatekeepers of the house and ministers of the house; (2 Chr. 29:34; 30:17) they shall slay the burnt offering and the sacrifice for the people, and (Num. 16:9) they shall stand before them to minister to them.

Because they ministered to them before their idols and (Is. 9:16; Mal. 2:8) caused the house of Israel to fall into iniquity, therefore I have (Ps. 106:26) raised My hand in an oath against them,” says the Lord GOD, “that they shall bear their iniquity.

(Num. 18:3; 2 Kin. 23:9) And they shall not come near Me to minister to Me as priest, nor come near any of My holy things, nor into the Most Holy Place; but they shall (Ezek. 32:30) bear their shame and their abominations which they have committed.
Nevertheless I will make them (Num. 18:4; 1 Chr. 23:28-32; Ezek. 44:11) keep charge of the temple, for all its work, and for all that has to be done in it.

(Ezek. 40:46) “But the priests, the Levites, ((1 Sam. 2:35); 2 Sam. 15:27; Ezek. 43:19; 48:11) the sons of Zadok, who kept charge of My sanctuary (Ezek. 44:10) when the children of Israel went astray from Me, they shall come near Me to minister to Me; and they (Deut. 10:8) shall stand before Me to offer to Me the (Lev. 3:16, 17; 17:5, 6; Ezek. 44:7) fat and the blood,” says the Lord GOD.
“They shall (Num. 18:5, 7, 8) enter My sanctuary, and they shall come near (Ezek. 41:22; Mal. 1:7, 12) My table to minister to Me, and they shall keep My charge.

And it shall be, whenever they enter the gates of the inner court, that (Ex. 28:39-43; 39:27-29; Rev. 19:8) they shall put on linen garments; no wool shall come upon them while they minister within the gates of the inner court or within the house.
